body_content.explanation: an occasion when someone is formally introduced into a new job or organization, especially through a special ceremony:
examples: Their induction into the church took place in June.
Her induction as councillor took place in the town hall.

body_content.explanation: a period during which a new member of an organization or a new member of staff learns about the organization and has basic training:
examples: New members will undergo a fitness induction.
The aim is to develop an effective induction course for new academic staff that will address their particular requirements.

body_content.explanation: the act of causing an event or process to happen:
examples: The doctor will determine whether to begin the induction of labour.

body_content.explanation: the process of discovering a general principle from a set of facts
the process of electrical power going from one object to another without the objects touching:

a form of this process used in some cooking devices, where metal coils (= wires) in the device create a magnetic field that induces (= causes) an electric current in the metal base of a pan, creating heat:
examples: Make sure that the pan is removed only when the food is cooked, otherwise the induction of heat will stop.
This is a portable induction hob that comes complete with its own cookware.
In induction cooking the energy is transferred directly to the pan by electro-magnetic field heating, so very little heat is wasted.
